content.description: Sustained climbing with no discernible crux other than possibly the last set of moves to the anchors.  Rest assured, they are large and easy to clip from so keep going.  This classic line is deserving of the stars and namesake as it has all the elements of great holds, good protection, esthetics and location.
content.location:
Third route to the right of dirty crack.  Look for large sloping, brown varnished foot hold at the start.

Southern CA sport climbing guide route # 878

content.description:
This climb is the 5th route from the left, just right of "

Welcome to New Jack City

". Starts with a hard move to get past the 1st bolt, turn a bulge(crux), climb up untill you can step across on to the wall to the right. Continue up good face another 50' to the anchors.

Left of the obvious boulder start of

Suddenly Susan

. Tricky opening moves followed by easier climbing leads to a second even trickier crux out of a shallow hueco to a jug, easier climbing to anchors.
content.location:
Between

Step Across

and

Suddenly Susan

content.description: Fun start; somewhat sequential for the first clip.  Well protected. OK to do while in the area, but keep heading down the way to your right as the routes get better.
content.location:
First route right of dirty/loose crack.

Southern CA sport climbing guide route # 876

content.description: Convenient but not as good as some of the others in the area.  Starts low angle on a somewhat forced line to the top.  Seems to naturally climb to the left of the bolt line or you find yourself in the broken gully.
content.protection: 9 bolts, large shut anchors, rap down
content.location:
First route on the far left.  Start just left of a dirty/loose crack.

Southern CA sport climbing guide route # 875

content.description: Fun start, fun route.  Well protected with neat and perhaps gymnastic moves.
content.location:
Second route on right from dirty/loose crack.  Somewhat bouldery start which trends slightly left around a left facing small dihedral.

Southern CA sport climbing guide route # 877
